title: The Medieval Islamic Civilization - Col.19 (Science, Technol. 5)
description:
The Medieval Islamic Civilization - Collection 19 (Science, Technology 5):

We have 15 titles here:

-  Berggren - Episodes in the Mathematics of Medieval Islam (1986)

-  Blake - Time in Early Modern Islam (2013)

-  Fontaine & Ahmad - Strategic Management from an Islamic Perspective; Text and Cases (2013)

-  Frank - Creation and the Cosmic System; Al-Ghazali & Avicenna (1992)

-  Gamal & Dols - Medieval Islamic Medicine; Ibn Ridwan's Treatise 'On the Prevention of Bodily Ills in Egypt' (1984)

-  Harley & Woodward (Eds.) - The History of Cartography; Vol. 2, Book 1; Cartography in the Traditional Islamic and South Asian Societies (1992)

-  Khan - Creation of the Universe; the True Description from Islam (2010)

-  Luz - The Mamluk City in the Middle East; History, Culture, and the Urban Landscape (2014)

-  Mitchiner - Oriental Coins and Their Values; The World of Islam (1977)

-  Morgan - Lost History; the Enduring Legacy of Muslim Scientists, Thinkers, and Artists (2007)

-  Nasr - Islamic Science; an Illustrated Study (1976)

-  Pomerantz & Shahin (Eds.) - The Heritage of Arabo-Islamic Learning; Studies Presented to Wadad Kadi (2016)

-  Ragab - The Medieval Islamic Hospital; Medicine, Religion, and Charity (2015)

-  Rahman - Avicenna's Psychology; an English Translation of Kitab Al-Najat, Book II, Chapter VI .. (1952)

-  Vrolijk & Hogendijk  (Eds.) - O ye Gentlemen; Arabic Studies on Science and Literary Culture (2007)
